availability.p: These master files are not intended for public distribution. Only derivative export files are licensed and released.

sourceDesc.p: The SBL Greek New Testament (SBLGNT v.1.2) is a critically edited edition of the Greek New Testament produced by the Society of Biblical Literature and Logos Bible Software, made available under a [CC-BY License] (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Available at https://github.com/LogosBible/SBLGNT.

Situations and moves were derived by Christopher D. Land using projection data in the original [OpenText annotation](https://github.com/OpenText-org/GNT_annotation_v1.0) together with the capitalization of the SBLGNT edition. Manual error correction was then carried out by Christopher D. Land and Doosuk Kim.

Stages were derived by Ryder A. Wishart by modifying the pericope headings of Robinson and Pierpont's Greek New Testament, which is in the public domain. Differences can be identified by comparing this data to the start and end tokens compiled by [James Tauber](https://github.com/jtauber/vocabulary-tools/blob/master/gnt_data/pericopes.txt).

Actions and grammatical values were generated by Christopher D. Land, derived in part from syntax markup from the Global Bible Initiative that has been made available at https://github.com/biblicalhumanities/greek-new-testament/tree/master/syntax-trees/sblgnt.

MorphGNT data by James K. Tauber, made available under a [CC-BY-SA License] (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/). Released as "MorphGNT: SBLGNT Edition. Version 6.12." Available at https://github.com/morphgnt/sblgnt.

context.title: Paul's Prayer of Thanksgiving and Intercession

token.note: The rule of thumb for combination I am adopting has genitive modifier to head np, then det to head np, then appositional np to head np (apposition usually involves specific, known np's--which are usually definite either by article or inherently [say a proper noun]).

context.title: The Work of the Exalted Christ through the Medium of the Ministry

module.values: differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance
differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

token.note: Uncertain whether should be "Christ in you [is] the hope of glory/Christ [is] the hope of glory in you."

module.values: differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

context.title: Christ's Work for His Church, Resulting in Sanctification

token.note: The subject of the verb could be God or Christ and the last pp could be in it (the cross) or in him (Christ).

context.title: The Affections of the Christians Set on Things Above
Putting Off the Old Man and Putting On the New

module.values: differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

token.note: Uncertain. Tree assumes that all 5 sins refer to expressions in speech, warning against outbursts of careless or malicious speech.
Two np's joined in meaning ("savage peoples") without conjunction doing the conjoining
Two np's juxtaposed in terms of condition of authority over self (slave or free) without a conjunction to mark the juxtaposition.

context.title: The Rule of God's Peace and Its Effect on Various Stations in Life

differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

token.note: Left-dislocated np clause, with "all things" in next clause referring back to it.

module.values: differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

token.note: Previous hINA clause interpreted as content of prayer and this hINA clause interpreted as purpose of prayer.

context.title: Personal Matters, Greetings, and Concluding Salutation

module.values: differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance
differentiating; juxtaposing; presuming; identifying; demonstrative; distance

token.note: See the discussion in the commentaries on the possibilities that this is a masculine or feminine name (along with variant readings of following pronoun--feminine pronoun in text goes with understanding as feminine name).
Assumes "the greeting [is written] by my, [namely] Paul's, own hand."
